alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 12 at 9:40PM CDT until June 12 at 10:45PM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: The National Weather Service in Fort Worth has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Johnson County in north central Texas... * Until 1045 PM CDT. * At 940 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Pecan Plantation, or 8 miles east of Granbury, moving northeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. * Locations impacted include... Mansfield, Burleson, Cleburne, Keene, Joshua, Alvarado, Venus, Godley, Cross Timber, Cleburne State Park, Lake Pat Cleburne, Rio Vista, Cresson, Briaroaks, Coyote Flats, Sand Flat, Egan and Lillian. This includes Interstate 35W between mile markers 18 and 37. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...<50 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection get inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows. This storm has a history of producing large hail. SEEK SHELTER NOW inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows!
